summary: Romantic multi-slide website featuring 4-line romantic shayari per slide, with optional background music (user requested 'Tum Hi Ho'), interactive music elements, and ending with a new mini-game where drawing/writing the name of an object/place/being transforms it into a 3D interactive model.
architectural_notes: Audio licensing/usage for 'Tum Hi Ho' must be clarified; avoid shipping copyrighted media without permission (consider user-provided file or royalty-free alternative).
Ending mini-game will require 3D rendering support (e.g., WebGL/three.js) and a defined approach for mapping user input (drawn/written names) to available 3D models/assets.

existing_features.title: Create a multi-slide romantic website where each slide displays exactly one 4-line romantic shayari (poem) with clear line breaks and readable typography.
Implement slide navigation with both click/tap controls (Next/Previous) and touch-friendly swipe/drag navigation, including a visible slide position indicator.
Add a final slide/page containing a cute teddy mini-game where touching/clicking the teddy triggers a cute reaction that is different every time (randomized from a set of reactions).
Define a coherent romantic visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, background treatment, button style) and apply it consistently across the slideshow and teddy mini-game.
Include a lightweight local settings control (no login) to toggle background music on/off and adjust volume; music must be optional and off by default.
Add generated static image assets (background and teddy art) into the app and render them from frontend static assets (not served by the backend).
Add the 'Tum Hi Ho' song as the background music track and wire it into the existing music toggle/volume system (music must remain optional and off-by-default).

Enhance the final Teddy mini-game so touching/clicking the teddy's hand triggers (1) a visible hand movement animation, (2) a spoken voice line from the teddy (client-side), and (3) a matching facial expression change.
Update the Teddy mini-game visuals to support independent hand animation by rendering the teddy as layered static assets (body + hand layer(s)) while keeping the existing overall theme and layout.
Replace the current final-slide mini-game (the teddy mini-game) with a different beautiful interactive mini-game on the ending slide, so the teddy is no longer shown as the final experience.
Implement the new ending mini-game as a dedicated React component and wire it into the slideshow so it renders as the final slide in place of TeddyGameSlide.

Design the new ending mini-game to feel like a 'beautiful' romantic interaction (e.g., a tap/click-driven visual effect game with progression and a clear end state), and ensure all user-facing text shown within the new game is in English.
Add optional interactive music (client-side sound effects) that reacts to user interactions (taps/clicks and slide navigation) while keeping background music behavior unchanged.
Extend the existing local audio settings and UI controls to support interactive sound effects as a separately configurable option (on/off) that is off by default and persists locally.

Make the ending mini-game’s sound effects feel responsive and progressive: play a pleasant, short sound on each tap that varies subtly (e.g., pitch/notes) and play a distinct completion sound when the goal is reached.

Replace the current ending mini-game (the heart-collecting EndingGameSlide) with a new final-slide experience where the user provides the name of an object, place, or being, and the scene changes to a corresponding interactive 3D model.

Implement the new ending mini-game as a dedicated React component that includes: (1) a simple “draw the name” area (freehand canvas) and (2) a text input that drives the actual selection; submitting the name swaps the displayed 3D model.
Add an interactive 3D viewer on the final slide that displays the selected model and supports user interaction (rotate/orbit, zoom, and pan as appropriate for desktop and touch).

Define a fixed, offline mapping from a small curated set of supported names (objects/places/beings) to bundled local 3D model assets, and show a friendly English message when the user enters an unsupported name.

Integrate the new ending mini-game with the existing local Sound Effects setting so interactions (submitting a name, model swap, and completion-style moment if you add one) trigger optional SFX while preserving the current background music behavior.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a romantic website with multiple slides, each containing a 4-line romantic shayari
Add background music using the 'Tum Hi Ho' song (optional/off by default with volume control)
Replace the final teddy mini-game with another beautiful interactive mini-game on the ending slide
Add interactive music elements (music that reacts to user interactions, e.g., taps/clicks or gameplay) in addition to the background music option
Replace the ending mini-game with one where the user draws/writes the name of an object/place/being and it transforms into a 3D interactive model the user can interact with

projectName: Romantic slideshow website with 4-line shayari slides and a cute interactive teddy mini-game
